resources.string: It’s here! The E17 Art Trail, the largest community-led arts festival in London.

Happening over 16 days from 3-18 June, this year sees over 7,000 local artists, residents, open studios, schools and workplaces across Walthamstow inviting you to enjoy every element of this year’s E17 Art Trail theme, STEAM, celebrating Science, Technology, Engineering, Art and Mathematics.
Waltham Forest Council is delighted to be supporting the E17 Art Trail again in 2017

The E17 Art Trail is recognised in the borough and beyond as making a significant contribution to local arts and culture, and improving the quality of lives of Waltham Forest residents. It showcases and celebrates the amazing talent, creativity, diversity, ambition, and hospitality of so many of our residents, creating a sense of pride for local people and attracting new visitors to the borough. In the spirit of William Morris, the E17 Art Trail is all about creative participation for residents, which reflects Waltham Forest’s aspirations for Art for All.
PROCESS: PAPER MAKING AND PRINT MAKING
The Lodge, Walthamstow School For Girls, Church Hill
Drop in to create your own paper and print. Explore and experiment with print - making possibilities to create your own print to take away
MARBLING AND SHAPE BUILDING WITH PLYCONIC"

Come and try this easy marbling, free workshop for kids. Hosted by local furniture maker Plyconic. Make your own piece of marbling art to take home. We will also have PlyShapes for kids to build mini sculptures with.
Fatimah Elizabeth Cates Academy, Frederick Bremer School, Siddely Road
A wonderful opportunity for people of all ages to experiment with Islamic calligraphy. Drop-in sessions organised with WF Stand Up to Racism.
Made by Ore, 30A Borwick Avenue, Unit 2

You will learn traditional silversmithing techniques such as soldering silver and hammering texture or letters to personalise your ring. At the end of the 2.5 hour workshop you will leave with a silver ring. Cost £35. Book in advance: 07980 213443
Pulse Studios, Unit K, Blackhorse Mews

The icing room take over Pulse - expect multi -sensory and collaborative encounters, with echoes of a secret society. The collective maintain their work in progress ethos. (Check Facebook for specific details.)
Open to all. A social and relaxed way to visit a host of E17 Art Trail exhibitions accompanied by local artists. Departing at 1pm we aim to visit 10 venues.
Saturday, 3 and Saturday, 10 June at 2pm and 4pm
Mirth, Marvel and Maud, 186 Hoe Street
Join the fun with Heather and step inside a unique Walthamstow story. For 3 - 8 years. Tickets £6 - book now at www.mirthmarvelandmaud.com
Outside William Morris Gallery, Forest Road
Our official cycle tour leaders, Waltham Forest Cycling Campaign, choose the best routes to make the most of discovering what’s on the trail on the opening day.

Join this tour for the morning or the whole day and revel in making creative discoveries in homes, cafes and parks. Waltham Forest Cycling Campaign will schedule pit stops, bring snacks/lunch/ refreshments.
Vestry House Museum Community Room, Vestry Road

Screening of short films produced in Walthamstow and beyond. Five minute drama, documentary, animation, experimental, silent and under 18s films from professionals, students and amateurs. Family friendly drop in event.
Walthamstow Pumphouse Museum, 10 South Access Road

Make animated films to illustrate the poem Speak Machine - a community STEM poem sampled by Forest Poets.Create and move props inspired by technology, transport and industrial heritage at the Pumphouse Museum. Screened on 18 June.
Town Square Entrance, The Mall, 45 Selborne Walk
Let off steam with DrumaSphere. Drumming together is fun. No previous experience necessary. Come and take part in this facilitated community drum circle.
SEARCHING FOR THE BUILDING BLOCKS OF LIFE IN SPACE

Dr David Quenard will give a talk about his research: Searching for the building blocks of life in space. 10 min talk followed by Q and A. Talks in partnership with Queen Mary University London to accompany Experimental Ceramics exhibiti on by Amanda Doidge.

MovE17 perform Anne Teresa de Keersmaeker’s seminal work Rosas danst Rosas and reveal the maths in the dance. Free entry. Enquiries/to learn the dance and perform at the Walthamstow Garden Party to clarefarrow2@gmail.com 07939 125014

Dr David Quenard will lead a workshop aimed at ages 5 to adult (younger siblings welcome!). In partnership with Queen Mary University London to accompany Experimental Ceramics exhibition by Amanda Doidge.
TELLING TALES TO LET OFF STEAM
Ye Olde Rose and Crown Theatre, 53 Hoe Street

BACKSTORY Ensemble present E17 writer Bren Gosling’s award-winning funny, sad and poignant flash stories, performed by Peter Kenny, Jean Woollard, musician and jazz singer Alice Mary J, and dancer Catriona Maccoll. Guests Mo Gallaccio and David McDade. Booking in advance recommended - 020 8509 3880
The footpaths of Waltham Forest fascinate and intrigue, but they are under threat. A walk exploring local footpaths to accompany the exhibition, meeting outside the Vestry House Museum.
Waltham Forest Community Hub, 18a Orford Road

Local artists of all ages will be showcasing and exhibiting their art work. Taster workshops for making and creating things will also be on offer. Family-friendly community event with live music and refreshments. Exhibition also on exterior of building 3-5 June. 020 8223 0707

Join us for puppets, live action and storytelling on an adventure through the Icelandic sagas with the legendary Volsung warriors. Magic, mythical wolves, gods, heroes and William Morris too! Ages 6+.
Harmony Hall, The Melody Room, 10 Truro Road

An exciting, funky and innovative concert including songs about the chemical elements (in line with the STEAM theme) with vocal harmonics, jazzy rhythms and tea, coffee and snacks. Why not join in, it’s free.
Celebrate the opening of Invisible Numbers and meet the artists; with refreshments and music.

Can you cook up a sound recipe? Sound collector, Del Taylor, invites young sound explorers to re-mix the music of the kitchen. For children 0-5yrs, their adults and siblings. Please book. morag@artillery.org.uk
Mother’s Ruin Gin Palace, Unit 18, Ravenswood Industrial Estate

We may all live to regret this, but Original Army Cabaret return to their spiritual home at Mother’s Ruin Gin Palace to bring the splendour that is Gingo! to the Art Trail. Buckle up and adopt the brace positi on…
Church of St Michael and All Angels, Northcote Road

Join UCL visualisati on experts in a workshop to produce images with an experimental device! Visible to the eye yet indecipherable, the images are revealed when viewed in long-exposure photographs. Free. Booking required. htt ps://ucldhpaintingwithlight.eventbrite.co.uk

You sit on my stairs - I sit at the bottom and play ukulele. What could possibly go wrong? There will be solo ukulele, a sing-song, and if you email me a song you would like to sing/hear I will do my best to play it. therapyman@hotmail.com
St Barnabas Church, St Barnabas Road
Build and decorate a 6 metre bridge with Waltham Forest Stand Up to Racism. Materials provided. 07970 803585
Mirth, Marvel and Maud, 186 Hoe Street

While away the afternoon, in Mirth’s art deco space: artists, makers, cocktails! An opportunity to buy something individual, ranging from handmade bags, fashion and jewellery to illustrations. Will you find that perfect gift?
INVISIBLE NUMBERS: ARTISTS TALKS AND VISITING GUEST SPEAKERS
A programme of talks to accompany the group exhibition, Invisible Numbers. Speakers: Face Invader; Denise Ford; Dr Simon Hubbert, Birkbeck; Dr Oliver Duke-Williams, UCL
RANDOM DEVIATIONS: THE SCIENCE OF RHYTHM

A West African percussion and dance workshop exploring the profound effect that rhythm has on our physiology with Mbilla Arts. First half will focus on rhythm and second half on rhythm with dance. All ages/abiliti es. Free.
ARTIST TALK ON CLOTHES ‘THE SECOND SKIN’
Old Station Yard Cafe, 186 Wood Street
A talk by artist Frances Cowper Holzhausen to accompany her exhibition, Look and Look Again. Book in advance by text or email. 07890 996916 or cowper@holzhausen.fsnet.co.uk
Displayed in various locations all across E17

Follow the ﬂock! Discover 1000 Swifts made by Walthamstow residents to celebrate the opening of Walthamstow Wetlands later in the summer. Swift maps will be available online and at E17 Art House, Stow Brothers, Debbie Bliss Home and The Mill. Twitter: @1000Swifts
Learning Lodge, Pimp Hall Nature Reserve E4 7HR

A fabulous collection of paintings, from a vibrant adult art class based at The Learning Lodge. Works from Chingford Drawing and Chingford Photographic Society. Open Air Drawing Competition, 17 June, 11am-3pm.
Light Haus Cafe, Lea Valley Works, 11a Argall Avenue, E10 7QE

Come to Argall industrial estate to see handmade ceramics from 30 Turning Earth makers, beautifully displayed in the Light Haus cafe at the front of the newly opened Lea Valley Works. Pop in for a browse and a coﬀee.
Studiolife, Upstairs at Arbeit Studios, Unit OH, East 10, Enterprise Park, Leyton E10 7DQ
A real-time immersion into our space to create. Experience Studiolife from the shared perspective of a writer and a maker.
Various locati ons around the Trail

Follow a trail of decorated bird boxes across diﬀerent E17 Art Trail venues. Find a notebook in each box and add to a collaborative story about the work on show. Devised by folklorist Elizabeth Dearnley and poet Emma Hammond. Follow social media to discover the Birdbox Story Trail @birdboxstories

Online exhibition launch. Eliyah Qureshi is a contemporary artist of South Asian descent. Her work can be viewed online throughout the E17 Art Trail at www.eliyahqureshi.com, at St Barnabas Church and at Pictorem Gallery.

Open shared studio of Mick Mills and Jane Cunningham, featuring vibrant painted collages, drawings and ﬁgurative ceramics. Please contact Jane for details of workshops and visiting outside opening times. 07973 562364
Higham Hill Hub, Higham Hill Park

Terriﬁc LEGO creations by adults and children. Expect to see castles, space ships, vehicles, houses and even LEGO art. Visitors can make their own creations in our LEGO play area and add them to the display.

Nostalgia, un-synced vintage home designs, invite you in for a ﬁrst peek at their unique take on reupholstered, up-cycled and re-purposed vintage furniture, celebrating the occasion with a display of 70s string art
Blackhorse Lane Studios, 114 Blackhorse Lane, E17 6AA

Experience artists’ private worlds and see the exhibition “Folding and Unfolding Time”, curated by Neil Irons. Place a bid in the Silent Auction. Enter the Kids’ Quiz and take a trip on Julie Caves’ tour of the studios.
Friday, 16 June, 6pm-9pm / Saturday, 17 and Sunday, 18 June, 12pm-6pm
Blackhorse Lane Studios, 114 Blackhorse Lane, E17 6AA
Greenpeace Waltham Forest have teamed up with artist Sandie M Sutton, to promote plastic reduction. Transform waste plastic into art. Free family drop in workshop 2-4pm on 17 and 18 June.
Friday, 16 June 8pm-midnight, Saturday, 17 and Sunday, 18 June 11am-midnight
Pulse Studios, Unit K, Blackhorse Mews

The MNFN collective have been bringing the best in experimental sound and music to E17 for the last year and a half. Join them at Pulse Studios for a series of auditory art installations, events and workshops. See website for full programme details www.morenewsfromnowhere.co.uk
ANNA ALCOCK’S: THE SUN IS SILENT
Inky Cuttleﬁsh Studios, Gnome House, 7 Blackhorse Lane

Based on Dante’s ‘Inferno’, relief prints exploring archetypes, the current cultural landscape, world aﬀ airs, sins, pleasures and the West’s descent into hell. Opening Party 3 June, 6-11pm with cheese and wine.
Sat-Sun 10am-2pm, Wed 2pm-8pm, Plus exhibition outside in daylight hours.

Do you need a mechanical toothbrush, or an automatic egg launcher? Come to Grow Your Own Theatre’s (Im)possible Inventors’ workshop. Inspired by Wallace and Gromit and Rube-Goldberg - see our ideas and create your own.
Higham Hill Library, North Countess Road

What would we see if our library was under the sea? Help us turn Higham Hill Library into an underwater world. Children’s art activities will take place on Saturdays to create a mural and crafty sea creatures and plants.
AT HOME WITH SEAN, ANNA AND JENNIE
Sean the writer and Jennie and Anna the artists are showing their work around the theme of “home”. Sean will be reading from his work. Jennie will also be launching her sewing book.
Manifestati ons of naked humanity. Contemporary, ﬁgurative works inspired by the old masters. Works on paper. Mixed media.
Experience the beauty of London as you have never seen it before.

Intrigued by the representation of the moon and the female form in art from artists such as Hiroshige to Mucha, I have been inspired to produce work ranging from black and white photographs to lino prints.
Beautiful hand carved furniture by John Bain. A clockwork chameleon, knife and fork crow and paper heron: sculptures by Ellie Noble.
The Amazing Illustrator Boy AKA Adam Graﬀ lets us into his world through photography with Walthamstow at its heart
Albert Road Studio, 74 Albert Road (side gate)

Kati e Smith, Jack Farrell, Alice Farrell and Angel Reid: A collective exhibition of ephemeral photographic landscape, thought-provoking installation, quirky pinhole photography and surreal illustration.
Mission Grove Primary School, South Site, 108 Edinburgh Road
Following on from their stunning collection of birds made by every class in 2015 the students of Mission Grove share their latest creations.

Paul, Elif and Anna Maria invite you to experience craft s colliding, by presenting a mixture of large-scale paintings, locally inspired urban prints and vintage smocked fabrics. Inﬂuences span from Istanbul to Dartmoor.
A collection of contemporary illustrations produced by the local artist Hatch
E17 Designers take over @Stow Brothers: exhibition of selected designers during the E17 Art Trail fortnight. Come to our market on Saturday 10th June at Mirth to buy what you like!

Photography by volunteers on ‘WE: the ex-Warner Estate in Waltham Forest’, a project supported by the Heritage Lott ery Fund. The photographs explore the details of decoration and everyday life across the estate.
